dialogues.text: Oh baby ... I love you ... From JULIA'S P.O.V., we see the form of FRANK shamble towards the lovers. From FRANK'S P.O.V. we see the lovers on the bed, LARRY's back vunerable.  JULIA seems to realize what he intends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... no ... LARRY barely hears her. FRANK is at the very end of the bed now, and JULIA becomes highly agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, you mustn't.  PLEASE. No. LARRY stops his love-making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost sobbing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  I can't bear it ... LARRY is angered and utterly perplexed at this.  He disengages his arms from around her. JULIA'S P.O.V., as FRANK retreats. LARRY rolls off JULIA. The wardrobe door closes.  Click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand you.  One moment you're all over me, the next it's:  Don't touch me. He sits on the edge of the bed. I just don't understand. He gets up and leaves the bedroom.  JULIA remains where she is.  We have a shot of the bed, and her upon it, from FRANK's end of the room.  She stares at the wardrobe.  Through the crack of the open door, FRANK stares back.  A flicker of lightning illuminates his face; his skeletal grin. Softly, beneath the assault of the rain on the roof, we hear laughter.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A SMALL RESTAURANT EVENING
dialogues.text: KIRSTY and LARRY are sitting eating a meal together, in an intimate restaurant.  LARRY has little appetite, to judge by his plate.  He looks as if he hasn't slept for several nights.  KIRSTY, by contrast, is sparkling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... maybe we should never have come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should give it some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skirting her real feelings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not like Mom.  She's ... I don't know ... moody.  I thought that was what you liked about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like her at all do you? The straight-forward question silences KIRSTY for a moment.  She wants to be delicate with her father's feelings, but honest at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know her.  She's so ... sealed up. LARRY's face is full of the desire for reassurance. KIRSTY tries to offer it. If YOU love her she must be worth loving.  Just give me some time. LARRY nods, a weak smile on his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't even want to leave the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like she's waiting for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't know. It's beyond me. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you ... maybe call round sometime?  Try to make friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe all she needs is some company.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STAIRCASE DAY
dialogues.text: FRANK is standing at the top of the stairs, dressed in his stained suit.  JULIA is a few steps down, staring up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the harm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then find me somebody else,  before they come looking. JULIA nods. Tomorrow? She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wind blows, carrying autumn leaves before it.  And on the wind, the distant pealing of bells.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP OF NUMBER 55 DAY
dialogues.text: JULIA is at the door, turning the key in the lock. Beside her, a third sacrificial lamb, balding and excitable.  His name is SYKES. JULIA opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LODOVICO STREET DAY
dialogues.text: At the corner of the street now:  KIRSTY.  She watches, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP OF NUMBER 55 DAY
dialogues.text: A long shot of the house, from KIRSTY'S P.O.V.  The man on the step seems to having second thoughts. JULIA speaks with him.  We can hear none of this exchange, but JULIA manages to coax him inside.  She closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LODOVICO STREET DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY stands, bewildered by what she's seen.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER LANDING DAY
dialogues.text: From the top of the stairs we watch JULIA lead SYKES upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get lonely sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody does.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY starts towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: In the corner of the room FRANK stands, tapping out the rhythm with his fingers.  It's 'Colonel Bogey', and now he hums it too.  Outside the door, a footfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. The humming stops. JULIA opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FRONT OF HOUSE DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY starts down the path.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: SYKES is looking at JULIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  A game? FRANK moves in the corner.  SYKES catches the motion from the corner of his eye.  He turns. What ? FRANK steps from the shadows. Jesus Christ. JULIA hits him with the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY hears SYKES scream.  She freezes.  Then steps back from the doorstep and looks up at the house.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: In the Room, pandemonium.  SYKES, blood pouring down his face, flails out at JULIA.  The hammer flies from her hand.  He lunges for the door, but she manages to kick it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ help me!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HOUSE DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY makes her way around the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: SYKES has taken hold of JULIA, and is using her as a shield against FRANK, whos is bearing down upon him.  For the first time we see FRANK's true colours where JULIA's concerned -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't! Casually, FRANK throws JULIA aside.  She falls, sobbing. FRANK descends on SYKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN DAY
dialogues.text: SYKES' scream covers the sound of KIRSTY forcing the back door open.  She steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: FRANK has SYKES face to the wall.  SYKES is sobbing now. The room is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julia)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. She picks herself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julia)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please ... don't let him kill me ... please ... JULIA leaves, closing the door. FRANK seizes hold of SYKE's neck, his fingers entering the flesh either side of his neck vertebrae.  SYKES screa

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN/DINGING ROOM/HALLWAY DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY moves through the house, and starts to climb the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER LANDING DAY
dialogues.text: Half way up the stairs, the scream stops.  She climbs the rest of the way surrounded by a graveyard hush.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: A soundless, slowed shot, as SYKES, his face wasted by FRANK's feeding, breaks from FRANK's hold and lunges for the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER LANDING DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY starts up the second flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: The same slowed, soundless horror, as SYKES reaches the door.  FRANK is a pace behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY reaches the top as -

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: The door from inside the room.  SYKES pulls it open -

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM FROM LANDING DAY
dialogues.text: In real time, and accompanied by the most horrific shriek, SYKES flings himself from the Torture Room. The flesh is hanging off his face; his eyes bulge in terror. Seeing KIRSTY he starts towards her.  Behind him, FRANK, his body glistening.  He catches hold of SYKES by the neck. SYKES'  shrieks stop.  The eyes glaze over.  The body judders as death claims it.  Then FRANK drops the corpse, and looks up at KIRSTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. She starts to back away down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty? He takes a step towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your fucking distance. Julia!  Where's Julia?  Christ, what have you done with her. She's still backing away. He's still advancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty.  It's Frank.  It's Uncle Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Daddy. Her puzzlement, however, has slowed her retreat,  and now FRANK reaches for her.  At the last moment she backs away again, but he's after her in a beat, and seizes hold of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Get the fuck off me. He drags her back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: He pushes her ahead of him, into the Torture Room.  He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've grown.  You're beautiful. She has retreated as far from him as she can get.  He advances on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me.  Or so help me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What will you do?  What can you do? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be frightened of. FRANK has closed in on her by now.  He Lakes hold of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you make your Daddy proud, don't you?  Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to tell myself that. Used to try and pretend I was dreaming all the pain.  But why kid yourself?  Some things have to be endured.  Take it from me. And that makes the pleasures so much sweeter ... As he leans in to kiss her she snatches hold of the pus and bloodstained shirt that's glued to his abdomen, and PULLS.  There's a flow of fluids. FRANK's head is thrown back, and he screams. She slips from beneath his grasp.  But he's after her in a moment, his hand catching her blouse.  It tears.  His fingers rake her bare skin. She stumbles, reaches out for the wall, which is slick with SYKES' blood.  Her hand slides over it.  She falls, heavily. Roaring, FRANK comes in pursuit of her. On the floor in front of KIRSTY:  the box.  It's a poor weapon, but it's all she's got.  As he comes after her again, she stands up and delivers a blow to his head with the box.  He howls.  She races for the door.  But he's after her.  He strikes her. She's thrown against the wall.  He's FURIOUS now. Strikes her again.  She cannot survive much more. She raises the box to retaliate.   FRANK sees what she's holding.  His  attack stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give that to me. She dimly realizes that she has a bargaining tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last time.  Give me the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it? The monster's eyes glitter. Fucking have it! She throws the box.  It sails past FRANK and smashes through the window.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: He goes to the window.  She takes her chance.  She's out of the door in a moment.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING DAY
dialogues.text: KIRSTY propels herself out of the Room, and down the stairs, while FRANK vents his anger above her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY DAY
dialogues.text: She flings open the front door, and pitches herself - bleeding and bruised - into the daylight beyond.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NUMBER 55 DAY
dialogues.text: As she stumbles away down the path, she sees the box at her feet, in a litter of broken glass.  She picks it up, and continues to run.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LODOVICO STREET DAY
dialogues.text: A series of shots from KIRSTY'S P.O.V., as she staggers along the street.  The sound-track whines; the image threatens to be eclipsed by darkness.  People stare at her as she runs.  A child points. Finally, the CAMERA slows.  She stands still. A voice, off camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? The CAMERA swings giddily around in the direction of the speaker.  A WOMAN comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need any help? As she speaks, the picture fades to white.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTY'S DREAM, (PART TWO)
dialogues.text: The whiteness continues to fill the screen.  Distant, incoherent voices are heard, and the thump of blood in the inner ear. Then darkness seeps into the whiteness, patterns like Rorschach inkblots: ambiguous, yet interpretable as sexual or horrific imagery.  With the darkness, soaking over the scene like blood through the sheet in her first dream, fragments of FRANK's previous dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things have to be endured ... The darkness is filling the screen ... take it from me ... Now, total darkness. ... Come to Daddy ... And suddenly, she wakes.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY is lying in a bed in a private room.  A NURSE is at her bedside, monitoring her condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're awake. She goes to the door. I'll get the doctor. She exits. KIRSTY tries to sit up.  Her head hurts, badly.  As she achieves a sitting position, the door opens.  The NURSE returns, with a DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching the bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ... you're back with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took quite a beating.  Do you remember what happened? She looks at him, uncertain of where to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak to my father ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  We'll bring you a telephone. The NURSE exits.  The DOCTOR brings the box from his pocket. Maybe this'll jog your memory. He lays it on the bed.  She stares at it, her expression betraying nothing. I had the Devil's own job getting it out of your hand. Does it ring any bells? She shakes her head. Do you want it left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? He offers her a reassuring smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chin up.  There's no serious damage.  And you're safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. He leaves the room. KIRSTY picks up the box, tentatively.  She turns it over in her hand, examining it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: FRANK is standing in the shadows.  He is wearing a fresh shirt.  He smirks.   JULIA watches him. Downstairs, the telephone rings.  JULIA is very nervous now; desperate even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll tell them everything ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  She'll want Larry first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably her now.  Or the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's very little I can do about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just leave -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this?  Look at me! LIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we can't just stay here -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a skin.  Then we leave -

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY is sitting up in bed.  On the bedside table, a telephone.  She is now thoroughly engrossed in the problems of the box.  Her fingers speed over the surfaces, looking for some way in, testing its strength. Suddenly, a click.  Her face lights up with pleasure, as she slides a part of the box open, revealing new intricacies.  And to accompany the revelation, a tinkling tune. She smiles.  It's a musical box. The light beside the bed flickers, but she doesn't notice. The door opens.  It's the NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck with your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably got a meeting. I called a friend of mine.  He's coming; is that O.K.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. The NURSE exits.  As she does go the light flickers again The box clicks.  A new facet is revealed ... KIRSTY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NUMBER 55 NIGHT
dialogues.text: The front door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia?

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: LARRY stands in the hall.  JULIA comes down the stairs. She looks pale; even ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where to begin ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better you see for your- self - She turns and starts up the stairs.  He follows.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY has opened more of the box.  The tune is more complex now. Somewhere a bell has started to ring.  Now, she works the final mechanism of the box.  The bedside light flickers and goes out. The bell rings.  Light pours out of the box.  She drops it, shocked. The bedside light comes on again. She looks up. In the wall opposite the end of her bed, a very narrow doorway has simply opened in the wall. Leaving the box on the bed, she gets up and goes to the gap.  As she approaches she hears the distant, rhythmical sob of a baby.  She stands at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CORRIDOR TO HELL NIGHT
dialogues.text: We look back at her, a diminutive figure framed against a shot of light, from way, way down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: The sobbing goes on.  KIRSTY stares down the corridor - which is lit brightly in some places, and is absolutely dark in others - not certain of whether to venture down it or not. She glances towards the door of her room, from the other side of which comes the reassuring sound of the hospital going about its business.  What's to fear?

dialogues.speaker: INT. CORRIDOR TO HELL NIGHT
dialogues.text: She steps into the corridor.    The walls rise into darkness on either side of her, their surfaces like the interior of a pyramid, pitted with age, and rotting away. She starts towards the sobbing child, bare feet on the impacted earth of the passageway. The sobbing gets louder as she advances, her form disappearing entirely as she passes through the intermittent darkness. Once, she glances back towards the Hospital Room, to reassure herself that it's still there.  It is, though it's no more than a sliver of light at the far end of the passageway. She advances a few more paces.  The atmosphere is growing denser; smoke thickens the air. Then, a light glows at the other end of the corridor. The sound of the sobbing child ceases. She stops walking. Ahead, the smoke clears and the light brightens, and we see a creature - THE ENGINEER - hanging in the space between the walls.  It is in silhouette against the light, but we can see enough to know that it resembles no earthly animal.  Its vast black limbs hold it suspended above the corridor, clinging to the stone. Its front limbs, vestigial by comparison, hang down from beneath its vast head.  Its tail is curled over its back. KIRSTY's expression registers this horror.  THE ENGINEER moves into the light.  Its irises narrow to slits. From the tail a vast sting, oozing pus - like venom, glides into view. And then - - it comes at her, advancing along the corridor by bracing its legs against the walls.  Its breath is a growl in its belly, until it moves into darkness, when all sound from it ceases, only to erupt  again as it finds the light. KIRSTY turns, and starts to run. It comes after her at speed.   Darkness, light, darkness, light; roars and silence - Its jaws spill its thick saliva; its eyes gleam. KIRSTY runs blindly down the corridor, back towards the safety of the Hospital Room.   But it's very close on her heels, lingering - As she comes within a few yards of the Room it closes on her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: She flings herself through the door with THE ENGINEER's breath on her back, and turns - The doorway has gone.  The wall is sealed.  She approache the wall.   THE ENGINEER scratches on the other side ... Then, she realises that the bell is still ringing.  And there's a foul smell in the air. She looks around. She's not alone. Standing across the room from her, lit by a strange phosphorescence that has no visible source, are four extraordinary figures. They are CENOBITES.   Each of them is horribly mutilated by systems of hooks and pins.  The garments they wear are elaborately constructed to marry with their flesh, laced through skin in places, hooked into bone. The leader of this quartet has pins driven into his head at inch intervals.  At his side, a woman whose neck is pinned open like a vivisection specimen.  Accompanying them is a creature whose mouth is wired into a gaping rectangle - the exposed teeth sharpened to points, and a fat sweating monster whose eyes are covered by dark glasses. When the lead CENOBITE speaks, we recognise the voice as that of the creature from the beginning of the film. KIRSTY stares in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you come from? The CENOBITE gestures.  The box is lying on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The box ... you opened it. We came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a puzzle box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a means to summon us - it's called the Lament Con- figuration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cenobites.  Explorers in the further regions of experience. Demons to some.  Angels to others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't mean to open that thing.  You can go back wherever you came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't.   Not alone. At this, the creature with the wired open jaw chatters like a mad monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You solved the box.  We came. Now you must come with us. Taste our pleasures. The chattering CENOBITE steps towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me! The door opens.  It's STEVE. KIRSTY's face floods with relief.  STEVE does not register the CENOBITES' presence however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve.  Thank God you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you? He steps between the CENOBITES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These THINGS ... they want to take me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirsty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't see us, or hear us. We belong to you, Kirsty.  And you to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let them take me, Steve -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let anybody take you. He starts to walk towards her, but the creature in the dark glasses takes a hooked rod from its back and puts the hook to STEVE's neck.   STEVE's hand moves to the place; he makes a small sound of pain. The CENOBITE takes off its glasses, to see its trick better.  The eyes beneath are sewn shut.  It pulls a little more on the hoo STEVE winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he takes another step, we open his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Steve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please go, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go.  PLEASE.  I'll be O.K. I'm going to go see Dad.  He'll look after me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you GO, damn you? Mystified, STEVE retreats a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come back later, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Why not? Still puzzled, STEVE crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time we were away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me alone, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tears please.  It's a waste of good suffering. The chatterer comes for her.  As it does so desperation brings a plan to KIRSTY's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time for argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this before, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a man called Frank Cotton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he escaped you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody escapes us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE did.  I've seen him.  He's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?   And what are you proposing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you to him.  Then you take him instead of me.  Back wherever you come from. The CENOBITE stares at her unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you cheat us ... The sound of THE ENGINEER, scratching on the other side of the wall.  The plaster cracks, violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll tear your soul apart! We cut back to the cracking plaster, which cracks further We hear STEVE's voice, and pan back into the room. The door opens.   KIRSTY and the CENOBITES have gone. STEVE is there, with the NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was trembling all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better go look for her. The NURSE heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's gone back to her - He looks round. The NURSE has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - father. His eyes have alighted on the box, which is lying on the bed. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NUMBER 55 NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lights burn in the house, upstairs and down.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: JULIA sits in front of the dressing table mirror. She has a glass of whisky in front of her.  She sips from it, studying her face in the mirror.  We've seen her in many moods through the story:  now we see a mingling of fear and exhilaration on her face.  She gets up.  Laid out on the bed is,of all things, her wedding gown.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STEVE'S CAR NIGHT
dialogues.text: STEVE drives towards Lodovico Street, scanning the street for sign of KIRSTY.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET NIGHT
dialogues.text: As his car drives past, KIRSTY turns a corner.  He does not see her.   KIRSTY hurries along the street.  The wind is chilly.   Sometimes she hears a bell in it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LODOVICO STREET NIGHT
dialogues.text: STEVE drives up to the house.  The lights are still burning.  He gets out of the car, and hurries down the path.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP NIGHT
dialogues.text: He knocks on the door.  There's no reply.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Two shadowy, naked figures stand face to face in the bedroom.  We can see no detail of their features.  We move down their bodies.  They are standing in a shining pool of blood.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP NIGHT
dialogues.text: STEVE starts round the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: The male of the couple pads towards  the bedroom door, leaving a trail of blood behind him.  We can still see very little of the man.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LODOVICO STREET NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY turns the corner of the street, and starts down it.  The wind is strong now.  It is full of sibilant whispers, hurrying her along.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: JULIA dresses.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY reaches the doorstep.  As she does so the whispers die away completely.   She beats on the door.   No reply. She beats again, more urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!   Dad!   It's me! It's Kirsty!

dialogues.speaker: INT. LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: JULIA steps onto the landing.  We can hear KIRSTY shoutin on the step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn her. We hear a voice, off-screen.  Is it FRANK or LARRY? Impossible to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY still beats on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, answer me!  Please - The door is suddenly opened.  JULIA is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty?   It's very late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping inside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to see my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  There's no need to shout.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINING ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: We pan across the table.  At the end of the table sits LARRY.  The light is behind him.  His features are shadowy.  But we can see that he is badly bruised. We hear the womens' voices, off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look terrible.  Have you had an accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was here this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't follow. What was there to see? KIRSTY doesn't answer, but walks through into the Dining Room.  KIRSTY sees LARRY at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.  Thank God. (she starts to sob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought something might have ... She glances round at JULIA, who has also entered. (to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. LARRY leans forward, and into the pool of light over the table.  He looks much the worse for wear.  His flesh is raw and bruised.  There is blood at his neck and hairline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, sweetheart. Julia's told me everything; and it's all right ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You don't understand. Your brother - Frank - he's here in the house.  And he's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever Frank did was his error. And it's finished with now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was insane, baby:  a mad dog. I put him out of his misery - KIRSTY stares at LARRY, while in her head she hears the CENOBITE's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we'll tear your soul apart ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go to the police, when I'm feeling stronger.  Try and find some way to make them understand, though God knows I don't really understand myself.  Did he hurt you? KIRSTY is dumb with horror at her situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Frank.  He's better off dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears in her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julia)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show her. KIRSTY turns away from LARRY.  JULIA leads her out into the Hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LARRY, still sitting at the table.  His fingers drum a familiar tattoo.   Beneath his breath, he hums 'Colonel Bogey'.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: JULIA pushes open the door of the Torture Room.  It creaks wide.  Lying on the floor inthe middle of the room is a skinned corpse, in a tangle of torn clothing. It steams.  There is blood everywhere.  That too, steams. KIRSTY is revolted.  She steps away from the door, back down the landing. The bell has begun to ring again, distantly, and there is the sound of wings in the air - thousands of birds - beating on the other side of the wall. KIRSTY starts down the stairs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? KIRSTY doesn't reply.  She merely hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave this to us, you hear me?   We'll deal with the police -

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY descends the stairs.  LARRY has stepped out of the Dining Room and is moving to intercept her as she makes her way to the front door. The sound of wings, and bells - and a terrible slow thunder which underpins it all - mounts in volume. LARRY snatches at her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get out. She shrugs off his arm.   The thunder is increasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with me - JULIA is on the stairs, watching this exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - it's all right.   Really it is ... He touches her face, fondly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay. She goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Daddy. She hesitates at the door, and turns.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY NIGHT, (KIRSTY'S P.O.V.)
dialogues.text: The thunder fills KIRSTY's head, as she stares at LARRY, who has opened his arms to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Daddy. Her gaze moves up to JULIA, who is on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, damn you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouths)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Everything is slowing down.  The bells and the thunder fill the soundtrack. LARRY smiles, as KIRSTY moves towards him.  Tears have begun to fill her eyes.   She searches for him.  His smile decays as he realizes her objective.   Her nails rake his cheek.   The flesh puckers, and tears along the brow.   Blood flows.   The mask of stolen flesh he wears slips a little, and FRANK's twisted features come into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank! KIRSTY screams, as FRANK lunges for her.  The lights in the hallway flicker, and threaten to go out. KIRSTY avoids FRANK's blow, but in doing so allows him to get between her and the front door.  She's trapped. His torn face flapping, he opens his jacket (the interior of which is blood-stained) and pulls a knife from the lining. Suddenly, JULIA is behind her, gripping hold of her hair. FRANK advances on KIRSTY, but in the last moment before the fatal stab KIRSTY twists, avoiding the blow.  JULIA shrieks and stumbles forward, the knife gleaming as it's buried to the hilt in her side. KIRSTY slips from between them.  JULIA collapses into FRANK's arms.   He holds her up. KIRSTY makes a dive for the front door, but FRANK lets JULIA slip and intercepts KIRSTY.  JULIA falls back against the wall, dying.  KIRSTY retreats to the bottom of the stairs.  FRANK follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not leaving now - As he follows, JULIA reaches out and takes hold of his sleeve. KIRSTY flees the only route she can, upstairs.  The house is creaking in every board and rafter now. FRANK turns on JULIA, trapping her against the wall.,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Frank. For God's sake. He puts his hands around her neck, and leans towards her.  At the last moment she seems to understand that he intends not to kiss her but to steal what little life she has left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Frank - From the stairs KIRSTY glimpses him battering upon her. Then she looks away, and runs up the stairs. When we look back JULIA is withering in FRANK's arms.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: The landing is smoky.  The lights have taken on a yellowish tinge.  The air is full of moans. KIRSTY is desperate for a hiding place.   She tries one of the doors, but it's locked.   She opens another, and the din of birds' wings gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BIRD ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: A P.O.V. shot, lunging towards KIRSTY in the doorway. She slams the door in the face of whatever's coming for her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: FRANK hears the door slam.   He drops JULIA to the ground.  She's dead, her flesh rotting on her face. FRANK starts to climb the stairs, his eyes burning with hunger.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY is cornered.   From below, FRANK's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, beautiful? KIRSTY starts up the second flight of stairs, as FRANK's shadow is thrown up on the wall below.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY is faced with a choice.  The Torture Room door is open, but the skinned body is in there, so instead she heads for the Junk Room, and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JUNK ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Moonlight falls through the window, illuminating a chaos of furniture and boxes.  She crosses to the window, and tries to get it open.   It won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somewhere below)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, honey? She looks around for a lever to open the window with -

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: FRANK reaches the landing and opens the bedroom door, calling for her. Then he starts up the last flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JUNK ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: KIRSTY lifts a cloth off one of the boxes. Staring up from the box is the corpse of PRUDHOE, his eyes and mouth open in a silent shriek. She reels back from the box, terrified, backing into the shadows. An arm reaches for her, taking hold of her and dragging her back into darkness as the door opens.  FRANK stands on the theshold.   His breath is thick.  He shambles forward, but he doesn't see her. We CUT back to the shadows.  KIRSTY's eyes are wild with terror. Back to the door, which clicks closed. KIRSTY breaks cover, and so does her saviour.  It's STEVE.  He is sweating with terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got in downstairs.  Looking for you.  What's going on? She shakes her head.   STEVE brings the box from his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot something - She doesn't see what he's produced.  She's already moving to the door.  She listens.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: The landing is empty.   The door of the Junk Room opens. KIRSTY steps out. The house is strangely still.  The lights swing a little; but otherwise ... nothing.  She advances along the passageway.  STEVE follows.  They reach the top of the stairs in safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signalled more than spoken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go first - As he speaks, FRANK steps out of the Torture Room, knife in hand. Roaring, he comes at them both.  KIRSTY flings herself out of the path of the knife.  FRANK swipes at STEVE, who falls backwards down the stairs.   He cries out, head hitting the stairs as he descends. The box falls from his unconscious hand. FRANK turns on KIRSTY, who avoids one slice of the knife, and another, but is driven back into the Torture Room.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: He's after her in a flash. She falls beside her father's body, her eyes meeting its skinned face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry for him.  He's dead. He always was. KIRSTY has been pushed to the limits of her endurance. She can be terrorized and pursued no longer.  Death looks an easy option by comparison with more of FRANK's horrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.   Kill me.  I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush now.   It's all right. Frank's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  Are you losing your mind, baby?  This is Frank you're talking to.  FRANK. As he speaks the bell begins tolling again.  FRANK looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Light begins to pour through the walls of the room. No. He starts towards the door.  But he's too late.  The CENOBITES are standing in his way.  He backs off from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cenobite)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to hear it from his own lips - FRANK turns on KIRSTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set me up!   You bitch. You set me up! The pattern of light in the room has become more elaborat and the CENOBITES move through it towards FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirsty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't for your eyes. KIRSTY crosses towards the door.  As she reaches for the handle she hears FRANK roar behind her.  She turns.   He breaks between the CENOBITES, knife in hand, but as he comes within striking distance the air is full of whining sounds and he stops dead. They have their hooks in him, we see.  In his arms and legs;  in his back and sides;  in his scalp and neck and temples.   Hooks attached to countless chains, which arrest his progress.  They plough through his flesh as he strives to reach her.  But at a gesture from the leade of the CENOBITES, the chains are hauled in.  He flings back his head, yelling.   The knife drops from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirsty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out! She turns back to the door and opens it.  FRANK is hauled back towards the centre of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch! The house is growling  from basement to eaves now, as KIRSTY steps onto the landing.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: Behind her, FRANK howls. She looks back. They have him IN EXTREMIS,    his body spread-eagled; hooks in a hundred places, pulling at his flesh.  He fights like a wild animal, snarling and cursing.  They pull the chains tighter.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TORTURE ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: A close up of FRANK's face.   He suddenly stops fighting. He raises his head, his eyes staring up at KIRSTY from beneath a bleeding, sweating brow.  He flicks his tongue over his bloodied lips. Then - - he comes apart.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPPER LANDING NIGHT
dialogues.text: The door slams as FRANK's body is torn apart in a welter of blood and flesh fragments. Something heavy thuds against the door. KIRSTY turns and starts down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STAIRS NIGHT
dialogues.text: As she reaches the place where STEVE is half-sitting, hal lying, the house starts to growl as though its foundation are about to give way.  STEVE's nose is bleeding, and his face is bruised, but he's conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here. They'll kill us for the fun of it. STEVE staggers to his feet.   KIRSTY picks up the box, which is on the lower landing. As she picks it up, the FEMALE CENOBITE steps from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave us yet - KIRSTY starts to try and manipulate the box in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got such sights to show you - KIRSTY manages to slot one of the pieces of the box back into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... don't ... Her voice becomes a howl, and she's sucked away into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind Kirsty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. They start down to the half-landing.  There stands the CENOBITE in the dark-glasses, carrying the hooked rod he threatened STEVE with in the hospital.  Again, KIRSTY manipulates the box.  Again, the CENOBITE howls and is claimed by the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: They hurry down to the hallway, half expecting another creature to step into their path.  Dust is falling from the ceiling, and there are cracks opening up  in the walls.  Any moment, surely, the whole place will be destroyed. JULIA's body has gone from the hallway;  a trail of blood leads into the dining room. As KIRSTY and STEVE stumble across the hallway, they hear JULIA's voice, off-screen, an eerie, ghostly voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty ... KIRSTY hesitates, and looks towards the door of the dining room. There stands the bride, her white dress soaked in blood, her veil covering her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia? KIRSTY takes a step towards her, but as she does so the veil rises of its own accord, and the chattering CENOBITE is beneath. KIRSTY slams the box closed. The CENOBITE howls, and disappears. STEVE heads for the door.  Turns the handle. As he does so, KIRSTY realizes there's one piece of the box unfinished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't! Too late.  He turns the handle.   The door is flung open, and THE ENGINEER, clinging to the sides of the door, swings down into the hallway. STEVE is flung backwards against KIRSTY.    The box falls from KIRSTY's hand.  The beast moves to bite at STEVE, who scrambles out of the way, leaving KIRSTY in the front line. The box lies between KIRSTY and THE ENGINEER, which now uses its forelegs to crawl over the hallway towards her, its legs still bracing it in the door. She snatches for the box.  THE ENGINEER, its mouth oozing fluids, almost catches her arm. Again, she tries.   This time one of its arms seizes hold of KIRSTY and drags her towards its jaws. Behind KIRSTY, STEVE snatches up a piece of plaster and flings it in THE ENGINEER's face.  It momentarily relaxes its grip on KIRSTY, who slides her hand from its hold and claims the box.  She now has slime on her finger The box defies her manipulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!   Come on! THE ENGINEER crawls towards them.  Up above, the din of the roof collapsing.  Timbers and dust hurtle down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Shit.  Shit. THE ENGINEER is almost upon her.  It rears up, its saliva dropping on her. And then, miraculously, the last piece of the box slots i place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same vortex that seized the other CENOBITE seizes THE ENGINEER.   Howling its complaint, it is drawn out into the darkness beyond the door, and disappears. Its voice grows thin, and fades. Finally, silence. The house is still. KIRSTY gets to her feet.  STEVE does the same. Together, they move to the door, and out onto the step.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOORSTEP NIGHT
dialogues.text: The door slams behind them, of its own accord. KIRSTY turns the sealed box over in her hand. There is a slit in it which has not quite closed.  Light suddenly pours from it, up into KIRSTY's face.  Her features are momentarily distorted, as if sucked towards the box.  From within:  shrieks, bells, music. Between the screams, FRANK's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Daddy! She slams the panel shut.  The distortions cease. So does the din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight. A smile crosses her face, and she leaves the doorstep, making her way towards the street.  STEVE gazes at her, then follows. Their figures are erased by the darkness. Somewhere, a bell rings as ...
